definition: scattered about like stars in the sky or chess pieces on a board (idiom); spread all over the place
chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: The coastal lines of Aegean Sea are long and winding where scatters with many gulf and dotted with numerous and island.
sentences.chinese: 爱琴海的海岸线非常曲折，港湾众多，岛屿星罗棋布。

sentences.english: With abundant rivers and lakes, China boasts many good swimmers.
sentences.chinese: 中国的河流湖泊星罗棋布，游泳健儿辈出。

sentences.english: It’s quite easy to find poppy fields as almost all the slopes in the vicinity of Faizabad are dotted with them.
sentences.chinese: 法札巴德附近的山坡上星罗棋布的罂粟田。

sentences.english: Nearly bird island Millions egrets flying sky on the island north of the lake.
sentences.chinese: 近观鸟岛上万千白鹭翱翔天空，湖面上岛屿星罗棋布。

sentences.english: Dozens more companies dot the Neihu-Hsinchu corridor.
sentences.chinese: 好多的电脑公司星罗棋布于内湖到新竹的通道。

sentences.english: Nam breasted mountain with the sea, beautiful scenery, monuments are spread all over.
sentences.chinese: 南安襟山带海，风光秀丽，名胜古迹星罗棋布。

sentences.english: They were crocuses, scattered whimsically throughout the front lawn.
sentences.chinese: 是番红花，在屋前草坪上星罗棋布到处都是。

sentences.english: Office of the top milk- hung upside down, the length and breadth, the water dropping, pleasant - sounding.
sentences.chinese: 厅顶乳石倒挂，星罗棋布，水珠滴落，悦耳动听。

sentences.english: The world cultural heritages of Europe spread all over the place and have their characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲世界文化遗产星罗棋布，各有千秋。

sentences.english: Islands are scattered all along China's coastline like stars in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 中国沿海岛屿星罗棋布。

definition: in picturesque disorder (idiom); irregular arrangement with charming effect
to cover the whole (area)/to be found throughout
uneven and jumbled (idiom); irregular and disorderly/in a tangled mess
lined up close (like teeth of a comb)
continuous (esp. of mountain ranges)/to stretch long and unbroken/a continuous link/sostenuto (sustained, in music)
to be situated/to be located (of a building)
